Name: Prague
Description: Prague, the capital and largest city of the Czech Republic, is known for its medieval Old Town, Gothic architecture, and vibrant cultural scene.

Name: South Bohemian
Description: South Bohemian region, famous for its beautiful landscapes, including ponds, castles, and the UNESCO World Heritage site Český Krumlov.

Name: South Moravian
Description: South Moravian region, known for its wine-making traditions, beautiful towns like Brno, and the Moravian Karst cave system.

Name: Plzeň
Description: Plzeň, known worldwide as the birthplace of Pilsner beer, features historical sites and beautiful old buildings.

Name: Karlovy Vary
Description: Karlovy Vary is famous for its thermal spas, picturesque town center, and the annual international film festival.

Name: Ústí nad Labem
Description: Ústí nad Labem is an industrial region located along the Elbe River, known for its natural beauty and proximity to the Ore Mountains.

Name: Liberec
Description: Liberec is situated in the northern part of the Czech Republic, known for its ski resorts and the stunning Ještěd Tower.

Name: Hradec Králové
Description: Hradec Králové is a historical city, known for its baroque architecture and being an important administrative and cultural center.

Name: Pardubice
Description: Pardubice, a region known for its horse racing traditions, rich history, and stunning architecture.

Name: Vysočina
Description: Vysočina is a picturesque region, known for its forests, lakes, and traditional villages, making it an ideal place for outdoor activities.

Name: Zlin
Description: Zlín is known for its unique functionalist architecture, with many buildings designed by the famous architect Tomáš Baťa.

Name: Moravian-Silesian
Description: Moravian-Silesian region is an industrial hub with a rich history, home to the city of Ostrava and surrounded by forests and mountains.
